result.execSummary:
The defendant Davene S. Row was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case recalled at 1:46 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Davene S. Row in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock submits certified driving record (marked as State Exh#1) and JOC for Dodge Co. Case #12CF137 (marked as State Exh#2)-received
Sentencing arguments by Counsel 

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for purposes of employment, medical/mental health treatment, AODA treatment & child care purposes; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--To pay fine of $600 + costs = $1449
--Reimburse Atty fees
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--Any other mandatory fees by statute to be imposed by Clerk
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No operation of a motor vehicle without valid DL and specific approval from Agent

Conditions Not of Probation:
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 2:14 pm

Case called at 8:37 am [Clerk SH] (Day 2 of 2) Jury Bailiff: D. Griffee
Defendant Davene S. Row in court with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses incident between Defendant and two jurors; Court finds that no court orders were violated; takes no action
Court rewiews with Ms. Row her right to/not to testify; Ms. Row informs the Court that she will testify

Davene Stephanie Row--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty Luchsinger
--cross exam by ADA Shock
--Counsel stipulate that on 3/11/12 the Def. license was suspended for 5 violations
--Juror question (marked as Court Exh#5) asked of witness by the Court
--Juror question (marked as Court Exh#6) asked of witness by the Court
--Juror question (marked as Court Exh#7) asked of witness by the Court
--Juror question (marked as Court Exh#8) asked of witness by the Court
--Juror question (marked as Court Exh#9) asked of witness by the Court
--Juror question (marked as Court Exh#10) asked of witness by the Court
Evidence closed at 10:18 am Jury Exits: 10:19 am 
Jury Instruction Conference (10:20 - off-record: 10:20 - 10: 25; 10:28 - 10:29 am - 10:30 am)
Recess: 10:30 am Reconvene: 10:51 am Jury Enters

Closing arguments given by ADA Shock (10:52 - 11:11 am)
Closing arguments given by Atty Luchsinger (11:11 - 11:31 am)
Rebuttal Closing arguments given by ADA  (11:31 - 11:36 am)
The Court instructs the Jury (11:36 - 11:52 am)
Deputy D. Griffee is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.
The alternate juror is selected through the tumbler system; Juror # is excused from the Jury. 
The Jury retires to deliberate at 11:53 am
Counsel agree that State Exhs #2 & #3 can be provided to Jury for use during deliberations. 
Recess: 11:54 am Reconvene: 12:56 pm
12:57 pm: Jury returns with its Verdict.

The Jury finds Ms. Row Guilty of Count #1, OWI (4th within 5 years)
The Court polls the Jury; their responses confirm the written verdict form.
Jury Exits: 1:00 pm ADA Shock orally motions for Court to accept verdict
The Court receives the Verdict, finds Ms. Row Guilty and orders Judgment of Conviction entered
Atty Luchsinger requests sentencing be deferred to later date in 3-4 weeks; ADA Shock - No objection
Court revokes bond per statute and remands custody of the Defendant to the Sheriff, to be heldwithout bail pending sentencing
Atty Luchsinger requests the Court defer entry of Judgment and allow Ms. Row time to get matters in order and not report to jail today 
Court presents basis and denies request
Recess: 1:06 pm 

NEXT:  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Courts exhibit #1 thru #10

Case called at 1:34 pm [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Davene S. Row in court with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock submits Notices of Intent & jury instruction
Counsel confirm they are ready to proceed to trial

ADA Shock: Do still plan to call 6 witnesses, need 1 day to present
Atty Luchsinger: Will have witnesses, need 1/2 - full day to present
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Luchsinger confirms that he has reviewed with Ms. Row that today is the last date she may enter plea on matter

5 strikes per side; 1 alternate
Jurors may take notes and ask questions

Notice of Intent to Admit Statements:
-No Miranda Goodchild hearing needed
-State's of Def. included in discovery will be admissible
Atty Luchsinger confirms that he has received all discovery

Notice of Intent to Present Audio/Video:
-No objection from Atty Luchsinger
Court grants - directs ADA Shock to have equipment tested before trial dates

Notice of Intent to Offer Expert Testimony
-No objection from Atty Luchsinger
-ADA Shock: Testify to contents of Ms. Row's blood & effects on body
Court grants & finds that William Johnson is expert in areas indicated by the State

State's Proposed Jury Instruction:
-Atty Luchsinger - No objection 
-Counsel have no special instructions to submit

Court reviews with Ms. Row her right to/not to testify at trial
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Shock indicates that there may be issue to address before jury is called in re: Defense expert witness - was given permission to voir dire witness without presence of jury. Atty Luchsinger provides brief overview of testimony. No objection to State conducting ind. voir dire of witness in absence of Jury. Counsel agree can be conducted during trial.
ADA Shock indicates that it is possible that he will be done with case late afternoon Monday
Atty Luchsinger: Only 1 witness-expert, unsure if client will testify. Have witness scheduled for Tuesday morning at this time
Court advises Atty Luchsiner to have witness available for Monday afternoon; Atty Luchsinger informs the Court that there will be much discussion about mental illness on this case, inquires of individual voir dire of jury panel, presents concerns regarding disclosure.
Court presents proposed procedure for voir dire & instructs Clerk to contact Bailiff re: procedure
Upon questioning of the Court, Counsel indicate that no witnesses have prior convictions for impeachment purposes
ADA Shock addresses video - is portion of video that discusses prior convictions - would like to submit instruction. Court grants upon no objection
Recess: 1:54 pm 

NEXT: Trial to proceed on Monday, 6/23/14 at 8:30 am (2 days)

Case recalled at 4:19 pm
Defendant Davene S. Row in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey M. Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Luchsinger informs the Court that Ms. Row missed Court earlier today because she fell asleep while awaiting a return call from individual providing transportation, so missed communication.
Court admonishes Ms. Row regarding her non-appearance earlier
Ms. Row informs the Court that her usual ride is out of town this week, otherwise would've been here. Ride will be back next week so future court appearances will be made. 
Court quashes warrant, and informs Ms. Row that It is not likely to quash any future warrants for non-appearance & it is likely that a cash bond will be ordered in the future for any non-appearances.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Row waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Atty Luchsinger requests case be set in usual course
ADA Shock requests matter be set for trial in June; Atty Luchsinger indicates he will be ready for trial in June
ADA Shock indicates that the State will have 6 witnesses - will need one day for State's case
Atty Luchsinger indicates that they will need 2 days for trial
off-record: 4:24 -4:26 pm to discuss scheduling
Court announces trial dates and reminds Ms. Row that her bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 4:28 pm

NEXT: (1) FSSC scheduled for 6/17/14 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) JT scheduled for 6/23-24/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Extradition Forecast

Case called at 3:10 pm [Case was scheduled for STC]
Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger in court. ADA Jeffrey M. Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Luchsinger: No explanation for non-appearance. Did speak with Ms. Row earlier today and she indicated that she would be here
ADA Shock requests warrant
Court reviews case file documents and previous hearing in which today's court date was announced in court and notices mailed were not returned as undeliverable. Hand written notice was also given to Ms. Row in court following last hearing.
Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only
Recess: 3:12 pm

Off-record: Atty Luchsinger informs the Court that he believes, due to Ms. Row's issues, she may have fallen asleep, requests the Court hear matter later in day if can produce Ms. Row.
Status conference on March 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 5, 2014 at 09:40 am.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 1:29 pm
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Davene S. Row in court with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
Court reviews initial appearance in which the Court appointed Atty Luchsinger but defered order of repayment until Atty Luchsinger appeared on matter
Court has colloquy with Ms. Row regarding finances, finds that Ms. Row is indigent and orders no reimbursement of Atty Fees
Court reviews conditions of bond with Ms. Row and confirms address on file is accurate

-Court orders bond to be amended to add condition:
 - No operation of a motor vehicle while under the influence of prescribed medication

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 3/5/14 at 9:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 3/20/14 at 2:30 pm - Send notices

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 9:58 am 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Davene S. Row in court. DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Right to Counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Service of Complaint admitted; charges/penalties recited; reading waived
Ms. Row informs the Cour that she is not eligible for SPD, but did have Atty Luchsinger on matter as this is previously filed case that was dismissed
Ms. Row submits petition for appt. of counsel

Davene Row--sworn & testifies
--exam by the Court

Court finds Ms. Row indigent and appoints Attorney Steven Luchsinger; Court withholds reimbursement terms at this time, further inquiry will be made on that topic when Atty Luchsinger appears on this matter.
Court tolls preliminary hearing time limits due to Ms. Row's request for counsel

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation without a valid d.l.
-  No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-  Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-  Booking at JCSD

NEXT: (1) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 2/21/14 at 1:15 pm - Send notices **A
Received a voice mail from the defendant advising she fell yesterday and hurt her back. She will not be able to make it to court today.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
